noun.description: In form prodd. A lightweight crossbow designed to shoot stones or bullets rather than bolts. Compare "arbalest" and "stone-bow"historical.
In form prod. The bow or bow assembly of a modern crossbow.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Francis Grose (d. 1791), antiquary. Originally a mistranscription by Grose of rodd in Office MS 1 Ed. VI, in which the word probably shows rod as a synonym for lath; hence the word is probably also misinterpreted in meaning by Grose.
